page.title: 09TRANSPORT
page.content: Many residents have their own trans- port, some families having two cars, so the public bus service has reduced to 2 return journeys daily which pass through Keevil and Bulkington to Devizes and Trowbridge. Coaches take students to the College and Clarendon School,Trowbridge and from Bulkington to Keevil School. Nearest railway stations are at Trowbridge and Westbury. 190 Keevil residents signed a petition in protest against the introduction of a double decker bus to replace 2 existing single decker services. Objection was on aesthetic and safety grounds, but this was overruled at a County Council meeting in April 1985. Application was made in Oct.85 to Tesco Stores for the inclusion of Keevil on their free shopping bus service to Trowbridge. A mobile library serves the villages.
